reports_msg: पिछले {{h}} घंटों में {{r}} रिपोर्ट प्राप्त हुई हैं
facebook_title: फेसबुक के माध्यम से रिपोर्ट करें
facebook_step1: फेसबुक मैसेंजर पर Riskmap.in के लिए खोजें
facebook_step2: 'Get Started' बटन पर क्लिक करें और बाढ़ स्थान, बाढ़ गहराई, फोटो अपलोड करने और विवरण निवेश करने के लिए निर्देशों का पालन करें
facebook_step3: आप दिए गए लिंक के माध्यम से मानचित्र पर अपनी रिपोर्ट देख सकते हैं। ताज़ा बाढ़ की जानकारी के लिए Riskmap.in देखें
telegram_title: टेलीग्राम के माध्यम से रिपोर्ट करें
telegram_step2: लिंक खोलें और बाढ़ स्थान इनपुट करने के लिए निर्देशों का पालन करें, फोटो अपलोड करें, और विवरण
telegram_step3: आप दिए गए लिंक के माध्यम से मानचित्र पर अपनी रिपोर्ट देख सकते हैं। ताज़ा बाढ़ की जानकारी के लिए RiskMap.in देखें
twitter_title: ट्विटर के माध्यम से रिपोर्ट करें
twitter_step1: @riskmapindia को एक प्रत्यक्ष संदेश (Direct message) भेजें
twitter_step2: @riskmapindia आपको रिपोर्ट भेजने के लिए एक बार का लिंक भेजेगा
twitter_step3: लिंक खोलें और बाढ़ स्थान इनपुट, फोटो अपलोड करने, और विवरण के लिए निर्देशों का पालन करें
twitter_step4: रिपोर्ट के सफल जमा करने पर, @riskmapindia आपको आपकी रिपोर्ट के लिंक के साथ एक जवाब भेजेगा
twitter_step5: ताज़ा बाढ़ की जानकारी के लिए RiskMap.in देखें
reports_stats: पिछले {hourplaceholder} घंटों में {reportsplaceholder} रिपोर्ट प्राप्त हुई हैं

info_content.intro: RiskMap.in वास्तविक समय में बाढ़ के बारे में जानकारी इकट्ठा करने, क्रमबद्ध करने और प्रदर्शित करने के लिए सोशल मीडिया का उपयोग करता है।
info_content.p1: RiskMap.in एक परियोजना है जो एम.आई.टी में अर्बन-रिस्क-लैब द्वारा दक्षिण और दक्षिणपूर्व एशिया में आपातकालीन प्रतिक्रिया और आपदा प्रबंधन लिए एक मुक्त और पारदर्शी मंच के रूप में शुरू की गई है।
info_content.p2: यह मंच लोगों को सबसे अच्छा ज्ञानेंद्री मानता है, जहां पुष्टि की गई रिपोर्ट सीधे उपयोगकर्ताओं से सड़क स्तर पर एकत्र की जाती है जो महंगी और समय लेने वाली डेटा संसाधन को हटा देती है। यह ढांचा सटीक और वास्तविक डेटा बनाता है जो तुरंत उपयोगकर्ताओं और पहले उत्तरदाताओं के लिए उपलब्ध कराया जाता है।
info_content.p3: RiskMap.in सामाजिक और डिजिटल मीडिया के शोर को निवासियों, समुदायों, और सरकारी एजेंसिय के लिए महत्वपूर्ण जानकारी में बदलने के लिए, विशेष रूप से विकसित कॉग्नीसिटी ओपन सोर्स सॉफ्टवेयर-आपातकालीन प्रतिक्रिया और आपदा प्रबंधन के लिए एक एंटरप्राइज़-स्तरीय मंच- का उपयोग करके आंकड़ों को इकट्ठा, क्रमबद्ध करने और दृश्यमान करता है|
info_content.p4:
नोट: किसी भी आपात स्थिति के लिए जिसके लिए तत्काल सहायता की आवश्यकता है, कृपया पुलिस - 100, अग्निशामक- 101, या एम्बुलेंस - 108 को कॉल करें।
केरल बाढ़ हेल्पलाइन - 1077.
ग्रेटर चेन्नई कॉर्पोरेशन हेल्पलाईन: 1913.
बृहन्मुंबई महानगरपालिका हेल्पलाईन - 1916.
बेंगलुरु म्युनिसिपल हेल्पलाईन: 1912
info_content.USAID: USAID के माध्यम से अमेरिकी लोगों के समर्थन के साथ यह वेबसाइट संभव हो गई थी। यह आधिकारिक यूएसएआईडी या यूएस सरकार की वेबसाइट नहीं है। इस वेबसाइट की सामग्री लेखकों की एकमात्र ज़िम्मेदारी है और करते हैं अमेरिकी सरकार के यूएसएआईडी के विचारों को जरूरी नहीं दर्शाते हैं।

user_agreement_content:
RiskMap User Agreement

 

This agreement governs your access to and use of RiskMap and the information and content on and functionality of the RiskMap site. By using RiskMap or contributing any information text, link, graphics, photos, videos or other materials (Content) to RiskMap, you agree to be bound by this agreement.

 

  1. About RiskMap

1.1 RiskMap is a project of the Urban Risk Lab at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). RiskMap is supported by MIT TATA Center for Technology and Design.

1.2 RiskMap collects Flood Reports from users to map flooding. The aim of RiskMap is to provide and share the best information on the locations of flooding in real-time to help residents and decision makers better respond to floods.

1.3 While that is our aim, the Content on RiskMap may not be always reliable. We trust contributors to provide complete and accurate information, but cannot represent or guarantee the completeness, accuracy or reliability of the Content posted on RiskMap. We do not take actions to confirm the accuracy of the Flood Report Content. Any use or reliance on Content on the locations of flooding on RiskMap, therefore, is at your own risk.

 

  1. Flood Reports

2.1 You may report a flood via a RiskMap Flood Report Card. Report Cards can be requested by asking the RiskMap Automated Program 'Bot' for a one-time-link via social messaging. Flood Reports submitted by you through RiskMap are added to the publicly available map at https://riskmap.in/map

2.2 Flood Reports may include the following data, which are shared publicly: Your location at the time of the report, social messaging account username or user identification number

RiskMap may at any time and for any reason reject or remove any Flood Report from the RiskMap site

  1. Flood Report Content

3.1 You are solely responsible for any content you provide to RiskMap. You must never add content owned by someone else, including photos, without explicit permission from the copyright holder. By submitting a Flood Report, you represent that you have all rights, licenses, consents, and permissions necessary to submit the content of the Flood Report and to grant and authorize us to grant the licenses described below.

3.2 We do not claim ownership of the content you submit in a Flood Report, but by submitting a Flood Report, you grant us a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable license to use, distribute and display your Flood Report and the content included in the Flood Report and to sublicense your Flood Report and its content under the Creative Commons Attribution

3.3 International License (For more details see the license at https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ ). This means that others will be able to copy and use the content of your Flood Report.

 

  1. Other Copyright and License Matters

4.1 RiskMap  is supported by Open Source Software and is provided without warranty. For more details, see the project license documentation

4.2 Content on RiskMap is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

4.3 If you believe that copyrighted material has been inappropriately added to RiskMap, please contact our designated copyright agent at risk@mit.edu or Urban Risk Lab, School of Architecture & Planning, 77 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, Massachusetts, 02139 United States. Notification must include:

  • Identification of the copyrighted material.
  • Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringed, including sufficient information for us to locate the material (e.g., URL, IP address, computer name).
  • Your contact information (e.g., email address, phone number).
  • A statement that you believe the use of the material has not been authorized by the copyright owner or an authorized agent.
  • A statement that the information in your notification is accurate and that you are or are authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.

 

  1. Data Privacy

5.1 We respect your privacy. For information about the data we collect and how we use and protect your data, please see our Privacy Policy.

 

  1. Disclaimer; Limitation of Liability

6.1 RISKMAP AND ANY INFORMATION, CONTENT OR SERVICES MADE AVAILABLE ON OR THROUGH RISKMAP ARE PROVIDED ON AN 'AS IS' AND 'AS AVAILABLE' BASIS AND WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND (EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR OTHERWISE), INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT AND ANY WARRANTY THAT THE SITE WILL OPERATE IN AN UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE MANNER OR BE FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS, EXCEPT INSOFAR AS ANY SUCH WARRANTIES MAY NOT BE DISCLAIMED UNDER APPLICABLE LAW.

6.2 EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT PROHIBITED by applicable law, we are not liable for, and expressly DISCLAIM, all liability for loss, INJURY or damage caused by the use of RiskMap and the Content on the site. This exclusion of liability includes, but is not limited to, any special, incidental, consequential, punitive or exemplary damages, such as loss of revenue, data, anticipated revenue, HOWEVER, AND WHENEVER CAUSED. This exclusion applies even if the Licensor knows or should know of the possibility of such damages.

6.3 If liability may not be excluded by law, each of our liability is limited to actual and direct financial loss conclusively found to have been caused by our own negligence.

 

  1. Indemnification

7.1 You agree to defend, hold harmless and indemnify each of us, and our respective subsidiaries, affiliates, officials, officers, faculty, students, fellows, governing board members, agents and employees from and against any third-party claims, actions or demands arising out of, resulting from or in any way related to your use of RiskMap, including any liability or expense arising from any and all claims, losses, damages (actual and consequential), suits, judgments, litigation costs and attorneys' fees, of every kind and nature. In such a case, one of us will provide you with written notice of such claim, suit or action.

  1. Miscellaneous

8.1 This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts in the United States and by applicable federal laws of the United States, without regard to any conflict of laws provisions thereof. In the event any provision of this agreement is found to be unenforceable, such invalidity shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this Agreement.

8.2 This, together with our Privacy Policy, is the entire agreement between you and us and supersedes any prior or contemporaneous agreement, whether written, oral or other, relating to the subject matter of this agreement. We may amend this agreement from time to time without notice, but any such amendment will not affect your use of or contribution of Content to RiskMap prior to the effective date of the amendment. You should revisit this agreement each time you use RiskMap or submit a Flood Report to ensure that you understand the agreement that applies to such use or submission.

8.3 Our failure to exercise or enforce any right or provision of these TOS shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision. If any provision of these TOS is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid, the parties nevertheless agree that the court should endeavor to give effect to the parties' intentions as reflected in the provision and the other provisions of these TOS shall remain in full force and effect.

 

Effective Date: February 19th, 2019
privacy_policy_content:
RiskMap.in Privacy Policy

 

Welcome to RiskMap, a website that collects and shares flood information from residents and government agencies, helping to reduce risk during flood events. RiskMap is a project of the Urban Risk Lab at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology ('we,' 'us,' 'our,' 'ours'). We are committed to respecting the privacy of users who access the RiskMap website (the 'Site,' which includes all pages within the RiskMap.in domain).

 

  1. Web Server Logs

1.1 When you visit the Site, including for submission of flood reports, our web server may record the following information in its server log:

  • your IP Address
  • the URLs you have requested to access,
  • the dates and methods of requests,
  • the status code of your requests,
  • URLs of pages that referred you to the Site,
  • number of bytes transferred,
  • your web browser and operating system platform,
  • your location (if you provide it),
  • your preferred language (based on browser preference), and
  • your social messaging account username or user identification number

 

1.2 We use server log information to help diagnose problems with our server and to administer our website by identifying which parts of the Site are most heavily used. We also use this information to tailor Site content to user needs and to generate aggregate statistical reports. Web server logs are retained on a temporary basis, during which time their contents are accessible to Site administrators, and then deleted completely from our systems. Unless required by legal process, we do not link IP addresses to any personally identifiable information. This means that user sessions will be tracked by IP address, but the user’s identity will remain anonymous.

 

1.3 We ordinarily do not disclose to third parties site usage by individual IP addresses, but we may do so in very limited circumstances to comply with the law or legal process or when working with consultants assisting us with fixing or improving the Site or monitoring and improving the security of our network.

 

  1. User-Generated Content

2.1 User-generated content is collected via flood report cards. You may request a flood report card via the RiskMap social messaging bot. You do not need to register to use flood report cards, although information you provide, including your social media username or ID number, is used to provide this service and contact you to confirm receipt of your report card. User-generated content will be available for all Site visitors to view and will identify you as the poster by the username from your social messaging account.

2.2 Any and all user-generated content that you post to the Site is publicly available to anyone who visits the Site, so do not post any information you do not want generally known to the public. More information about information collected through report cards can be found in our User Agreement.

 

  1. Research Access to Data

In addition to providing flood information to residents, government and disaster-response agencies, RiskMap data facilitates academic research into risk reduction. Any content you post to the Site may be used for academic research.

 

  1. Programming Analytics

In order to refine the resources on offer through the Site and to optimize RiskMap.in programming, we may elect to conduct internal analytics of content submitted by users. Any such internal analytics will be conducted on an anonymized set of user-generated content.

 

  1. Google Analytics

5.1 We use Google Analytics software to perform Site usage analytics. Google Analytics collects anonymous information from users to help us track Site usage and referrals from other websites. These data are used primarily to optimize the website experience for our visitors, but we may also use the data to assist us in marketing the Site.

5.2 Information collected and processed by Google Analytics includes the user’s IP address, network location, and geographic location. Google Analytics acquires all its information directly from the user, by installing a cookie (see below) on JavaScript-enabled computers. The Site does not share any information it collects with Google, and Google does not collect any personally identifiable information.

 

  1. Cookies

Cookies are unique bits of computer data that many major websites will transfer to your computer the first time that you visit. Cookies are stored on your hard drive and maybe later accessed by the website to track prior usage. As noted above, Google Analytics will install a cookie on the hard drives of Site visitors.

 

  1. Disclosure To The Third Parties

7.1 We will not sell, lend, or disclose to third parties any personally identifiable information we collect, except as discussed in this Policy or required by law or legal process. We may disclose information to MIT employees, fellows, students, consultants and agents who have a legitimate need to know the information for the purpose of fixing or improving the Site and monitoring and improving the security of our network. We may also disclose this information when special circumstances call for it, such as when disclosure is required by law or legal process or when disclosure is, in our judgment, necessary to protect our legal rights, including intellectual property rights.

 

  1. Other Websites

8.1 This Site may contain links to other web resources, including websites of organizations other than the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The websites to which the Site links may also install cookies on your computer, log your access to their web pages, or collect user-identifying information directly from you, once you proceed to those sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites to which the Site links. The privacy policies on those sites, if any, will govern your use of the sites.

 

  1. Data Security

We have in place physical, electronic and managerial procedures to protect the information we collect online. However, as effective as these measures are, no security system is impenetrable. We cannot completely guarantee the security of our database, nor can we guarantee that the information you supply will not be intercepted while being transmitted to us over the Internet.

 

  1. Notification of Changes In The Privacy Policy

10.1 We will review our security measures and Privacy Policy on a periodic basis. We may change our Privacy Policy from time to time based on those reviews or because we add or change services or features. If we change our Privacy Policy, we will post it on the Site. We encourage you to review our Privacy Policy on a regular basis.

 

10.2 If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, the practices of this Site, or your dealings with this Site, you can contact risk@mit.edu or Urban Risk Lab, School of Architecture and Planning, 77 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge 02139, Massachusetts, United States.

 

Effective Date

This Privacy Policy is in effect as of 19th February 2019.
